thread.title_full: Incredible moonlit drone footage captures Iceland's midnight surfers

author: Hugh Morris
title: Incredible moonlit drone footage captures Iceland's midnight surfers
text:
A post shared by OZZO Photography (@ozzophotography) on Feb 1, 2017 at 8:02am PST 
But it’s the frozen shots of Iceland’s frosted coast that look at their best in the shimmering moonlight. Gulfoss, a thundering waterfall in the south of the country, can be spotted, too, as can the unmistakable standalone peak of Kirkjufell in the west. The famous Northern Lights provide occasional additional lighting. 29 reasons why Iceland is incredible 
"Our goal was to try to create something new, to see Iceland in a different way most people see it," explained Oli Haukur, from Ozzo Photography. 
"It's even more beautiful during night, but to do this we need to have a full moon in order for the camera to pick up enough light to be able to film. The snow sure helps when it's dark. It helps us luminate the landscape." 
Ozzo Photography specialises in filming the island. 
Among its work is the music video for Cold Water, a song by Major Lazer featuring Justin Bieber, filmed across Iceland. 
Another film showcases a mountain biker’s exploration of the country’s other-worldly landscape. best hotels in iceland
